ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

Has someone ever  blackmailed you because you have sex with men?

Has someone ever forced you to have sex when you did not want to? (Oral, anal, vaginal, manual, penetration with an object) [Do you believe you have been forced to have sex because you have sex with men?]
Have you ever felt excluded from family activities because of [your sexual orientation and/or your gender identity]?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, because of my sexual orientation; 2= Yes, because of my gender identity; 3= Yes, but I do not know why

ElementDescription: How often have you been refused health care because of your sexual orientation?
How often are you afraid of seeking health care because of your sexual orientation?
Many people don't accept homosexual individuals
Men who have sex with men would lose their heterosexual partners if those partners knew about their homosexual relationship
Many employers would underestimate a man due to his attraction to men regardless of his qualifications for the job
Many people would treat a man who has sex with men differently than others
Many people have negative attitudes towards men who have sex with men
Many people do not see men who have sex with men as normal men
Men who have sex with men are not welcome in public gatherings, for example, party, night club, meeting, etc.
Many families would be disappointed to have a son who has sex with men
Many people think that most men who have sex with men are HIV positive and will die of AIDS
Many people think that most men who have sex with men are promiscuous
Many health staff show unpleasantness or negative attitudes while dealing with men who have sex with men
Sometimes, you wish you were not attracted to men
Sometimes, you think that if you were not attracted to men, you would probably be happier
To avoid disclosure of your sexual orientation, you have tried to stop being attracted to men
Sometimes, you wish you could become more sexually attracted to women
You feel that being attracted to men is a personal shortcoming for you
Sometimes, you feel ashamed of your sexual orientation
You are afraid family and friends will find out about your sexual orientation
How often have you lost a job or career opportunity due to your having sex with men?
You try to look masculine in order to avoid other's rejection
How often has your family rejected (separated, disregarded, etc.) you because of your sexual orientation?
How often have you lost a friend because that person knows you have sex with men?
How often have you been teased or cursed by others because you have sex with men?
How often have you been hit or beaten due to your sexual orientation?
How often have you been kicked out of school for your sexual orientation?
How often have you changed accommodation due to your sexual orientation?
